user_controllers

Class InputValidityChecker

  • java.lang.Object
    • user_controllers.InputValidityChecker

  • public class InputValidityChecker
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that asks input from user and makes sure that the input in valid.

    • Method Detail

      • isValidYearInput

        public int isValidYearInput(int newInput)
        Checks if an input from user is a valid year. If not, keeps asking user until a valid year is given.
        Parameters:
        newInput - the input user first given.
        Returns:
        a valid input asked from the user.

      • isValidMonthInput

        public int isValidMonthInput(int newInput)
        Checks if an input from user is a valid month. If not, keeps asking user until a valid input is given.
        Parameters:
        newInput - the input user first given.
        Returns:
        a valid input asked from the user.

      • isValidDayInput

        public int isValidDayInput(int newInput,
                           int year,
                           int month)
        Checks if an input from user is a valid day for the month and year. If not, keeps asking user until a valid input is given.
        Parameters:
        newInput - the input user first given.
        month - the month to check.
        year - the year to check.
        Returns:
        a valid input asked from the user.

      • isValidHourInput

        Returns:
        a valid input asked from the user.

      • isValidInput

        public java.lang.String isValidInput(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> validInputs,
                                     java.lang.String newInput)
        Checks if an input from user is valid. If not, keeps asking user until a valid input is given. Valid inputs are provided in the parameter.
        Parameters:
        validInputs - an ArrayList of all the valid inputs.
        newInput - the input user first given.
        Returns:
        a valid input asked from the user.
